div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

li.a: Centers of Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

ul.li: Andes Central School District will be closed through the end of the school year, due to the governor’s recommendation concerning COVID-19.

Andes Central School District will continue the food service program through May 21, 2020 for any child 18 years old and younger from 11:30 am-12:00 pm. Breakfast and Lunch will be provided Monday-Friday. We won’t be serving meals on Good Friday and Easter Monday (April 10th & 13th). Families within city limits may pick up their meals at the main entrance of the school. Meals will be delivered to the Community Center in the White Swan Housing in Lake Andes. Those outside these locations within the district will need to contact the school by 4:00 pm for deliveries the next day. Deliveries will follow the paved roads on regular bus routes.

Andes Central School District will continue to provide weekly learning packets for students PK-12th grade through May 21, 2020, to be picked up by parents / students at the school from 11:30 am-3:00 pm in the main entrance. Please remember to return your student’s work when completed. Staff will be preparing packets weekly to be distributed. If your student has a library book, please also return to the school.
SDHSAA has cancelled the remaining athletic events for the 2019-2020 school year.

Parents will be able to contact their child’s teachers by phone or email only. Please call 487-7671 or staff emails are available under the directory which is located on the website and mobile app under Menu-Staff.
During this time and for the safety of staff, students, and parents, please do not go beyond the main entrance/lobby of the school.

For more information concerning COVID-19, please visit the following resources:
DOE https://doe.sd.gov/
State of SD https://sd.gov/
SDHSAA https://www.sdhsaa.com/
DOH https://doh.sd.gov/
CDC https://www.cdc.gov/
Andes Central School District will be closed through May 1, 2020, due to the governor’s recommendation concerning COVID-19.

Andes Central School District will continue the food service program during this time for any child 18 years old and younger from 11:30 am-12:00 pm. Breakfast and Lunch will be provided Monday-Friday. We won’t be serving meals on Good Friday and Easter Monday (April 10th & 13th). Families within city limits may pick up their meals at the main entrance of the school. Meals will be delivered to the Community Center in the White Swan Housing in Lake Andes. Those outside these locations within the district will need to contact the school by 4:00 pm for deliveries the next day. Deliveries will follow the paved roads on regular bus routes.

Andes Central School District will continue to provide weekly learning packets for students PK-12th grade, to be picked up by parents / students at the school from 11:30 am-3:00 pm in the main entrance. Parents/students will need to return the packet to the school when work is completed or when meals are being distributed. If your student has a library book, please also return to the school in a plastic bag.

Parents will be able to contact their child’s teachers by phone or email only. Please call 487-7671 or staff emails are available under the directory which is located on the website and mobile app under Menu-Staff.
During this time and for the safety of staff, students, and parents, please do not go beyond the main entrance/lobby of the school.

For more information concerning COVID-19, please visit the following resources:
DOE https://doe.sd.gov/
State of SD https://sd.gov/
SDHSAA https://www.sdhsaa.com/
DOH https://doh.sd.gov/
CDC https://www.cdc.gov/

div.h5: School Closure Free Meals Public Announcement

hr.p: The Andes Central School District is committed to the nutritional needs of our students.
Meals at No Charge for children 18 years & younger

Andes Central is providing FREE meals Monday – Friday beginning Monday, March 23, 2020 from 11:30 am to 12:00 pm for any child 18 years and younger. These meals will be graband-go sack meals that can be picked up and taken home to eat. Please send only healthy members of your family to pick up. Those who are not feeling well, should stay home. Use the main entrance of the Andes Central School at 1001 High Street, Lake Andes. A Distribution Location to pick up meals will be located at the White Swan Housing Community Center. The district may deliver meals to families living outside the city limits. You must call the school by 4 p.m. the previous day. District vehicles will travel on paved roads only.
Delivery points will be determined on a case by case basis. Call 605-487-7671 for more information.

ul.li: Andes Central School District will be closed next week, March 23-27, 2020, due to the governor’s recommendation concerning COVID-19.

Andes Central School District will begin food services for any child 18 years old and younger beginning Monday, March 23rd from 11:30 am-12:00 pm. Breakfast and Lunch will be provided Monday-Friday. Families within city limits may pick up their meals at the main entrance of the school. Meals will be delivered to the Community Center in the White Swan Housing in Lake Andes. Those outside these locations within the district will need to contact the school by 4:00 pm for deliveries the next day. Deliveries will follow the paved roads on regular bus routes.

Andes Central School District will be providing weekly learning packets for students PK-12th grade, to be picked up by parents / students beginning Monday, March 23rd at the school from 11:30 am-3:00 pm in the main entrance. Parents/students will need to return the packet to the school when work is completed or when meals are being distributed.

Parents will be able to contact their child’s teachers by phone or email only. Please call 487-7671 or staff emails are available under the directory which is located on the website and mobile app under Menu-Staff.
During this time and for the safety of staff, students, and parents, please do not go beyond the main entrance/lobby of the school.

For more information concerning COVID-19, please visit the following resources:
DOE- https://doe.sd.gov/
State of SD- https://sd.gov/
SDHSAA- https://www.sdhsaa.com/
DOH- https://doh.sd.gov/
CDC- https://www.cdc.gov/
